Mayapur (WB).title: ISKCON Temple
Mayapur (WB).description:
In September 2021, after the long months of lockdown, I embarked on my first college trip to the serene and spiritual town of Mayapur. Organized by my college club, Voice, this trip was a unique opportunity to explore a place I've always been curious about. Accompanied by seniors, some unknown friends, and Prabhu Ji, we set out on this journey, which promised to be an enriching experience.

Mayapur, known as the birthplace of Lord Chaitanya, the founder of the Gaudiya Vaishnavism tradition, is a place filled with spiritual energy and devotion. Our 2-3 days there were a perfect blend of devotion, learning, and camaraderie. We participated in vibrant kirtans, where the chants and music filled the air with a sense of peace and joy. The Radha Rani darshan was a highlight, offering us a glimpse of divine beauty and serenity.

One of the most memorable parts of the trip was the multiple sessions with the devotees. These interactions provided deep insights into the philosophy of devotion and the teachings of Lord Chaitanya. Chanting sessions were equally uplifting, as we immersed ourselves in the holy names, feeling a deep connection with the divine.

This trip to Mayapur was more than just a getaway; it was a journey within, a chance to reconnect with spirituality and form bonds with like-minded individuals. The experience left an indelible mark on my heart, reminding me of the peace and joy that comes from devotion and community.

Ranchi (Jharkhand).title: Dassam Falls
Ranchi (Jharkhand).description:
My first trip 150 km away from college was an exciting adventure to Dassam Falls in Ranchi. The journey itself was just as memorable as the destination. We set out early in my friend's car, with Vinay behind the wheel, guiding us smoothly along the highway. The thrill of the open road, combined with continuous music playing throughout the trip, set the perfect mood for our adventure.

Dassam Falls, located near Ranchi, is one of the most popular and picturesque waterfalls in Jharkhand. The drive to the falls was filled with anticipation, and the sight of the cascading water as we arrived did not disappoint. We spent three hours at the falls, soaking in the natural beauty and enjoying the peaceful ambiance. The sound of the water crashing down the rocks was both calming and invigorating.

Although our time at Dassam Falls was limited, we made the most of it by exploring the surrounding area and capturing the stunning views in our minds and cameras. The cool mist from the falls provided a refreshing break from the day's heat.

On our way back to Jamshedpur, we stopped at a roadside dhaba for lunch. The simplicity and flavor of the dhaba food were a highlight of the trip, adding a touch of authenticity to our journey. After a satisfying meal, we continued our drive back, feeling content and rejuvenated.

This trip to Dassam Falls was a perfect blend of adventure, nature, and camaraderie, leaving us with cherished memories of a day well spent.

Ranchi (Jharkhand).title: Chandil Dam
Ranchi (Jharkhand).description:
On our way back from Dassam Falls to Jamshedpur, we made an impromptu stop at Chandil Dam, a decision that added a serene touch to our already memorable day. Nestled amidst picturesque hills, Chandil Dam is a tranquil spot that offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape.

As we approached the dam, the vast expanse of water reflecting the evening sky greeted us, creating a peaceful atmosphere. The stillness of the water, coupled with the gentle breeze, provided a perfect contrast to the excitement of Dassam Falls. We spent some time walking along the dam, taking in the natural beauty and enjoying the calmness that enveloped the area.

This unexpected detour to Chandil Dam was a refreshing pause in our journey, allowing us to connect with nature once more before heading back to the hustle and bustle of college life. It was a fitting end to a day filled with adventure and exploration.

Ranchi (Jharkhand).title: Patratu Valley
Ranchi (Jharkhand).description:
Saurav, one of our friends, started to panic and urged us to return to college. It took some convincing, but eventually, he agreed to press on. Despite the rain and the uncertainty, we kept going, determined to make the most of our trip. By the time we reached Ranchi around 8 PM, the rain was still relentless, and we were soaked to the bone, our clothes muddy and uncomfortable.

In desperate need of dry clothes, we headed to a mall, only to be met with curious stares from the shoppers. Feeling out of place, we quickly left and found a smaller shop, eventually landing at V2, where we bought fresh clothes. After some much-needed shopping, we found a place to stay for the night.

The next morning, we finally reached Patratu Valley, and the sight that greeted us made every struggle worthwhile. The view was breathtaking, with lush greenery and rolling hills stretching as far as the eye could see. Our challenging journey had led us to a moment of pure beauty and satisfaction, reminding us that sometimes the most difficult paths lead to the most rewarding destinations.

However, the adventure didn’t end there. On our return trip to Jamshedpur, our rented bike suddenly stopped working on the highway. Vinay had an online assessment (OA) scheduled for the evening, so we told him to head back to college without us. The four of us were left to push our 200 kg bike along the highway under the scorching 36-degree noon sun. This unexpected ordeal turned into yet another adventure, testing our endurance and camaraderie.

Despite the heat and exhaustion, we managed to get the bike to a mechanic shop. It was a challenging experience, but one that added another layer of unforgettable memories to our trip. This journey taught us that true adventure lies in embracing the unexpected and finding joy in overcoming obstacles together.

Banaras (UP).title: Banaras Ghat
Banaras (UP).description:
In June 2022, I embarked on my first interstate trip with my cousins to the ancient and sacred city of Varanasi. This 3-day adventure was filled with unforgettable experiences that left a lasting impression on all of us.

Varanasi, often referred to as the spiritual capital of India, has a unique vibe that resonates with the essence of life and death. The city's energy is palpable, and we felt it the moment we arrived. One of the first things we did was take a holy dip in the Ganges River, an act that holds great spiritual significance. The cool waters of the Ganga seemed to wash away not just physical impurities, but also the stresses of daily life.

Visiting the newly developed Vishwanath Corridor was another highlight of our trip. The grandeur of the Kashi Vishwanath Temple, nestled within the corridor, left us in awe. The corridor, with its wide pathways and beautifully crafted architecture, provided us with a serene space to connect with the divine.

Evenings in Varanasi are magical, and watching the Ganga Aarti was a mesmerizing experience. The synchrony of chants, the glow of lamps, and the devotion of the crowd created an atmosphere of profound spirituality. We also spent some peaceful time at the Ganga Ghat at night, soaking in the calmness and reflecting on the day's experiences.

This trip to Varanasi with my cousins was more than just a vacation; it was a spiritual journey that deepened our bond and left us with cherished memories of the city’s timeless charm.

Kolkata (WB).title: Durga Puja & Science City
Kolkata (WB).description:
Last October, I (Guddu) and a few friends visited Kolkata to experience the grandeur of Durga Puja. The city was alive with lights, music, and vibrant decorations. Every pandal we visited was a unique work of art, showcasing incredible creativity. The devotion and energy during the evening aarti were unforgettable, making us feel deeply connected to the festive spirit.

After soaking in the cultural splendor, we headed to Science City, eager to explore Kolkata’s scientific side.The Space Theatre’s 3D show was a highlight, taking us on a breathtaking journey through the universe. The Evolution Park, with its life-sized models of dinosaurs and other creatures, was both educational and fascinating.

The Dynamotion Hall offered hands-on experiments with sound, light, and optical illusions, making learning fun and interactive. We ended our visit with a ride on the Ropeway, which gave us a stunning view of the Science City complex and the city beyond.

Our trip to Kolkata was a perfect mix of tradition and modernity, leaving us with memories of vibrant celebrations and inspiring discoveries.

Barabar (Bihar).title: Barabar Caves
Barabar (Bihar).description:
In February 2021, shortly after starting college, I had the chance to embark on my first trip with my cousins without any family members. Our destination was the Barabar Mountains, located about 20 km away from Jehanabad. Known for their ancient caves and scenic beauty, the mountains promised an adventure we were all excited about.

We began our day early, packing some fruits, chips, and cold drinks to fuel our trek. The morning air was crisp as we set off on our trek up the Barabar Mountains. The climb, though challenging, was exhilarating, and we completed it in about two hours. Along the way, we were treated to stunning views of the surrounding landscape, which only grew more breathtaking as we ascended.

At the summit, we were rewarded with a panoramic view of the city below. The sight was awe-inspiring, and we felt a sense of accomplishment as we stood at the top, taking it all in. After exploring the Barabar Caves, known for their ancient rock-cut architecture and historical significance, we spent the rest of the day relaxing and enjoying each other’s company.

One of the highlights of our day was dancing on the mountain top, a spontaneous moment of joy that perfectly captured the spirit of our trip. As the day drew to a close, we reflected on the adventure we had shared, knowing that this experience would be a cherished memory for years to come.

This trip to Barabar Mountains was not just an adventure but also a bonding experience that brought us closer together, creating memories that will last a lifetime.

Puri (Orissa).title: Jagannath Temple
Puri (Orissa).description:
In January 2023, I embarked on an unexpected 2-day trip to Puri with my friends Shashi and Vinay. The spontaneity of the trip added to the excitement, and we set off from college with little more than a plan to enjoy the serene coastal town.

Puri, known for its beautiful beaches and spiritual significance, welcomed us with its calm and inviting shores. We spent a good part of our time at Puri Beach, soaking in the sun, feeling the sand beneath our feet, and letting the waves wash away our worries. The beach was a perfect spot for relaxation, offering a peaceful retreat from our usual college routine.

Our visit to the Jagannath Temple was a highlight of the trip. The temple, with its grand architecture and deep spiritual ambiance, left us in awe. As we joined the throngs of devotees, we felt a profound connection to the history and culture that the temple embodies.

The trip took an exciting turn when we traveled to IIT Kharagpur to attend a show by King, a popular music artist. Thanks to Harsh, who made our entry possible, we got to experience the electrifying atmosphere of the IIT KGP fest. The energy of the crowd and the powerful performance by King made the night unforgettable.

This spontaneous trip to Puri was a perfect blend of relaxation, spirituality, and entertainment. It not only provided us with a much-needed break but also created memories that we’ll cherish for a long time.

Agra (UP).title: Taj Mahal
Agra (UP).description:
After attending my grandparents' 50th anniversary in Gurugram, Kunal and I found ourselves craving a little adventure. On a whim, we decided to visit Agra to witness the iconic Taj Mahal. However, booking train tickets in India can often feel like a nightmare, especially on short notice. Faced with this challenge, we made the bold decision to travel without tickets—a risky move, but one that added an unexpected thrill to our journey.

The journey to Agra was anything but easy. Navigating the crowded train without reserved seats tested our patience and resourcefulness. Yet, despite the challenges, we successfully reached Agra, excited to explore the city. The sight of the Taj Mahal, with its majestic white marble glistening in the sunlight, made all the hardships worthwhile. Standing before one of the world's most famous monuments, we were filled with awe and a sense of accomplishment.

No visit to Agra is complete without indulging in its famous sweet, Petha. We savored the local delicacy, which added a sweet note to our adventure. As our trip drew to a close, we were relieved to manage two tickets for the return journey, ensuring a more comfortable ride back.

This spontaneous trip to Agra was a blend of challenges and rewards, teaching us that sometimes the best experiences come from the most unplanned adventures. The memory of standing before the Taj Mahal and the taste of Petha will forever be etched in our minds.

Rajgir (Bihar).title: Shanti Stupa & Jungle Safari
Rajgir (Bihar).description:
Rajgir, a place steeped in history and natural beauty, has always been a favorite destination of mine. My visits to this ancient city have been filled with both serene experiences and thrilling adventures. The first time I visited Rajgir, I was eager to explore everything the city had to offer, but unfortunately, we couldn’t manage tickets for the jungle safari. Instead, we spent our time visiting the iconic Shanti Stupa and Ghoda Katora.

Shanti Stupa, perched atop a hill, offers a tranquil atmosphere and panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. The peacefulness of the place, combined with the spiritual energy it exudes, made the visit memorable. Ghoda Katora, a serene lake surrounded by hills, provided a perfect spot to relax and soak in the natural beauty of Rajgir.

My second visit to Rajgir was even more exciting. This time, with Kunal, we successfully managed to get tickets for the jungle safari and the newly introduced glass bridge. The jungle safari was a thrilling experience, taking us through the dense forests of Rajgir, where we got to witness the rich biodiversity of the region up close.

The glass bridge, a recent addition to Rajgir's attractions, was an adrenaline-pumping experience. Walking on the transparent bridge, with the forest beneath our feet, was both exhilarating and slightly nerve-wracking. The view from the bridge was nothing short of spectacular, offering a unique perspective of the lush greenery below.

These visits to Rajgir have shown me the city's diverse offerings, from its peaceful monuments to its thrilling adventures, making it a place I always look forward to returning to.

Deoghar (Jharkhand).title: Baidyanath Jyotirlinga Temple
Deoghar (Jharkhand).description:
In August 2021, I embarked on a spiritual journey to Deoghar, a town known for its religious significance and the Baidyanath Jyotirlinga Temple. The trip was organized by my college club, Voice, and was a unique opportunity to explore the spiritual heritage of India.

Deoghar, located in Jharkhand, is a place of pilgrimage for devotees of Lord Shiva. Our visit to the Baidyanath Jyotirlinga Temple was a deeply moving experience. The grandeur of the temple, with its intricate carvings and spiritual ambiance, left us in awe. The energy and devotion of the devotees added to the sacred atmosphere of the temple.

We also visited the Naulakha Mandir, a beautiful temple dedicated to Goddess Parvati. The architecture and craftsmanship of the temple were impressive, reflecting the rich cultural heritage of the region. The serene surroundings of the temple provided a peaceful space for reflection and prayer.

Our trip to Deoghar was more than just a pilgrimage; it was a spiritual retreat that allowed us to connect with our inner selves and explore the teachings of Lord Shiva. The camaraderie and shared experiences with fellow travelers added to the richness of the journey, creating memories that will stay with us for a lifetime.

Simdega (Jharkhand).title: Kurpania Dam
Simdega (Jharkhand).description:
In July 2022, I embarked on a day trip to Kurpania Dam in Simdega, Jharkhand, with my college friends. The trip was a spontaneous decision, born out of a desire to explore the natural beauty of the region and spend quality time together.

Kurpania Dam, located about 30 km from our college, is a serene spot surrounded by lush greenery and rolling hills. The drive to the dam was a scenic journey, with the beauty of the countryside unfolding before us. As we approached the dam, the sight of the tranquil waters and the gentle breeze filled us with a sense of peace and tranquility.

We spent the day at the dam, enjoying the cool waters and the picturesque surroundings. The sound of the water flowing over the dam created a soothing backdrop to our conversations and laughter. We also explored the nearby areas, taking in the natural beauty and capturing the moments in our cameras.

One of the highlights of our trip was the boat ride on the dam. Drifting along the calm waters, surrounded by the beauty of nature, was a truly relaxing experience. The boat ride allowed us to connect with the serenity of the place and enjoy the company of friends.

This day trip to Kurpania Dam was a perfect blend of adventure, nature, and camaraderie, leaving us with cherished memories of a day well spent.

Mysore (Karnataka).title: Mysore Palace
Mysore (Karnataka).description:
In October 2022, I embarked on a day trip to Mysore with my college friends. The trip was a spontaneous decision, born out of a desire to explore the rich cultural heritage of the city and spend quality time together.

Mysore, known for its grand palaces, vibrant markets, and rich history, is a popular tourist destination in Karnataka. Our visit to the Mysore Palace was a highlight of the trip. The palace, with its stunning architecture and intricate details, left us in awe. The grandeur of the palace, illuminated by thousands of lights, created a magical ambiance that transported us to a bygone era.

We also explored the bustling Devaraja Market, a vibrant hub of activity where we sampled local delicacies and shopped for souvenirs. The sights, sounds, and smells of the market added to the sensory experience of our trip, immersing us in the culture of Mysore.

One of the highlights of our visit was the evening at the Brindavan Gardens. The musical fountain show, set against the backdrop of the illuminated gardens, was a mesmerizing experience. The synchronized dance of water, light, and music created a magical atmosphere that captivated us.

This day trip to Mysore was a perfect blend of culture, history, and camaraderie, leaving us with cherished memories of a day well spent.

Gurugram (Haryana).title: Kingdom of Dreams
Gurugram (Haryana).description:
In November 2022, I embarked on a day trip to the Kingdom of Dreams in Gurugram with my college friends. The trip was a spontaneous decision, born out of a desire to experience the vibrant culture and entertainment of the region.

The Kingdom of Dreams, located in the heart of Gurugram, is a unique entertainment destination that showcases the rich diversity of Indian art, culture, and heritage. Our visit to the Kingdom of Dreams was a sensory delight, with colorful performances, lively music, and exquisite craftsmanship.

We spent the day exploring the various attractions at the Kingdom of Dreams, from the Nautanki Mahal, where we enjoyed a Bollywood-style musical, to the Culture Gully, a vibrant boulevard of shops and eateries. The Street Performances, with their energetic dances and music, added to the festive atmosphere of the place.

One of the highlights of our visit was the Zangoora show, a high-energy musical extravaganza that left us spellbound. The grand sets, dazzling costumes, and powerful performances by the artists made it a truly memorable experience.

This day trip to the Kingdom of Dreams was a perfect blend of entertainment, culture, and camaraderie, leaving us with cherished memories of a day well spent.

Jamshedpur (Jharkhand).title: Jubilee Park
Jamshedpur (Jharkhand).description:
In August 2022, I embarked on a day trip to Jubilee Park in Jamshedpur with my college friends. The trip was a spontaneous decision, born out of a desire to explore the natural beauty of the region and spend quality time together.

Jubilee Park, located in the heart of Jamshedpur, is a sprawling green space that offers a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of city life. The park is known for its lush gardens, colorful flower beds, and recreational facilities, making it a popular destination for locals and tourists alike.

We spent the day at the park, exploring its various attractions and enjoying the serene ambiance. The Rose Garden, with its vibrant blooms and sweet fragrance, was a delight to the senses. We also visited the Jayanti Sarovar, a picturesque lake that added to the beauty of the park.

One of the highlights of our trip was the boating experience at the lake. Drifting along the calm waters, surrounded by the greenery of the park, was a truly relaxing experience. The boat ride allowed us to connect with the serenity of the place and enjoy the company of friends.

This day trip to Jubilee Park was a perfect blend of relaxation, nature, and camaraderie, leaving us with cherished memories of a day well spent.

Bangalore (Karnataka).title: Lalbagh Botanical Garden
Bangalore (Karnataka).description:
In September 2022, I embarked on a day trip to Lalbagh Botanical Garden in Bangalore with my college friends. The trip was a spontaneous decision, born out of a desire to explore the natural beauty of the region and spend quality time together.

Lalbagh Botanical Garden, located in the heart of Bangalore, is a sprawling green space that offers a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of city life. The garden is known for its lush greenery, colorful flower beds, and diverse plant species, making it a popular destination for nature lovers and tourists alike.

We spent the day at the garden, exploring its various attractions and enjoying the serene ambiance. The Glass House, with its stunning architecture and vibrant floral displays, was a highlight of our visit. We also visited the Kempegowda Tower, a historic monument that offers panoramic views of the garden and the city beyond.

One of the highlights of our trip was the boating experience at the lake. Drifting along the calm waters, surrounded by the greenery of the garden, was a truly relaxing experience. The boat ride allowed us to connect with the serenity of the place and enjoy the company of friends.

This day trip to Lalbagh Botanical Garden was a perfect blend of relaxation, nature, and camaraderie, leaving us with cherished memories of a day well spent.
